aspectTool.description: An adapter type is a NIEM object type that adapts external models for use within NIEM. An adapter type creates a new class of object that embodies a single concept composed of external elements.
aspectTool.name: Adapter Type (AssociationClass)

aspectTool.description: An adapter type is a NIEM object type that adapts external models for use within NIEM. An adapter type creates a new class of object that embodies a single concept composed of external elements.
aspectTool.name: Adapter Type (Class)

aspectTool.description: A NIEM association is a specific relationship between NIEM objects. Associations are used when a simple NIEM property is insufficient to model the relationship clearly and when properties of the relationship exist that are not attributable to the objects being related. Each end of the NIEM association is represented by a UML association end. Note that a UML association class may also be used.
aspectTool.name: Association Type (AssociationClass)

aspectTool.description: A NIEM association is a specific relationship between NIEM objects. Associations are used when a simple NIEM property is insufficient to model the relationship clearly and when properties of the relationship exist that are not attributable to the objects being related. Each end of the NIEM association is represented by a UML association end. Note that a UML association class may also be used.
aspectTool.name: Association Type (Class)

aspectTool.description: Augmentation application is a relation between a property whose type is an «AugmentationType» and a class. It restricts the classes that may have the property. Note that an «Augments» generalization may also be used.
aspectTool.name: Augmentation Application (Usage)

aspectTool.description: A NIEM augmentation type is a complex type that provides a reusable block of data that may be added to object types or association types.
aspectTool.name: Augmentation Type (AssociationClass)

aspectTool.description: A NIEM augmentation type is a complex type that provides a reusable block of data that may be added to object types or association types.
aspectTool.name: Augmentation Type (Class)

aspectTool.description: Augments specifies what type an augmentation augments. Multiple augmentations may be inherited by a type or used as the types of properties. Note that a property with an «AugmentationApplication» as its type may also be used.
aspectTool.name: Augments (Generalization)

aspectTool.description: A choice is a group of properties such that when used as the type of a property exactly one of them may have a value in any instance of an enclosing type.
aspectTool.name: Choice (Class)

aspectTool.description: A list is a simple type having values each of which consists of a finite-length (possibly empty) sequence of atomic values. The values in a list are drawn from some atomic simple type (or from a union of atomic simple types), which is the item type of the list.
aspectTool.name: List (DataType)

aspectTool.description: Metadata application is a relation between a «MetadataType» class and any other class. It restricts the types that may have the metadata.
aspectTool.name: Metadata Application (Usage)

aspectTool.description: NIEM metadata is defined as "data about data." This may include information such as the security of a piece of data or the source of the data. A Metadata Type models metadata.
aspectTool.name: Metadata Type (AssociationClass)

aspectTool.description: NIEM metadata is defined as "data about data." This may include information such as the security of a piece of data or the source of the data. A Metadata Type models metadata.
aspectTool.name: Metadata Type (Class)

aspectTool.description: Object type is the default for UML classes. A NIEM object type represents data about things with their own identity and lifespan that have some existence. An object may or may not represent a physical thing. It may represent something conceptual.
aspectTool.name: Object Type (AssociationClass)

aspectTool.description: Object type is the default for UML classes. A NIEM object type represents data about things with their own identity and lifespan that have some existence. An object may or may not represent a physical thing. It may represent something conceptual.
aspectTool.name: Object Type (Class)

aspectTool.description: Property holders are used to define properties that have no specific owner, or "top level" properties. These properties are generally referenced by other properties.
aspectTool.name: Property Holder (Class)

aspectTool.description: A References realization reuses class and property definitions from another class or namespace and is the basis for reusing NIEM reference namespaces.
aspectTool.name: References (Realization)

aspectTool.description: A Restriction Realization represents a relationship between two type definitions: the first is derived by restriction from the second. The two types must either both be NIEMType Classes or both be DataTypes. If the two types are Classes, then the attributes of the client class must be a subset of the attributes of the supplier class and omitted attributes must have a multiplicity lower bound of zero. if the two classes are DataTypes, then the client type is considered to have a value space that is a subset of that of the supplier, as may be further specified using a ValueRestriction stereotype on the client. This relationship is implemented in XML Schema through the base attribute on the xsd:restriction element of the first type definition, the actual value of which resolves to the second type definition. If a type is a ValueRestriction the generalization owned by that type is implicitly an XSDRestriction.
aspectTool.name: Restriction (InterfaceRealization)

aspectTool.description: A Restriction Realization represents a relationship between two type definitions: the first is derived by restriction from the second. The two types must either both be NIEMType Classes or both be DataTypes. If the two types are Classes, then the attributes of the client class must be a subset of the attributes of the supplier class and omitted attributes must have a multiplicity lower bound of zero. if the two classes are DataTypes, then the client type is considered to have a value space that is a subset of that of the supplier, as may be further specified using a ValueRestriction stereotype on the client. This relationship is implemented in XML Schema through the base attribute on the xsd:restriction element of the first type definition, the actual value of which resolves to the second type definition. If a type is a ValueRestriction the generalization owned by that type is implicitly an XSDRestriction.
aspectTool.name: Restriction (Realization)

aspectTool.description: A Restriction Realization represents a relationship between two type definitions: the first is derived by restriction from the second. The two types must either both be NIEMType Classes or both be DataTypes. If the two types are Classes, then the attributes of the client class must be a subset of the attributes of the supplier class and omitted attributes must have a multiplicity lower bound of zero. if the two classes are DataTypes, then the client type is considered to have a value space that is a subset of that of the supplier, as may be further specified using a ValueRestriction stereotype on the client. This relationship is implemented in XML Schema through the base attribute on the xsd:restriction element of the first type definition, the actual value of which resolves to the second type definition. If a type is a ValueRestriction the generalization owned by that type is implicitly an XSDRestriction.
aspectTool.name: Restriction (Substitution)

aspectTool.description: NIEM differentiates between an object and a role of the object. The term "role" is used here to mean a function or part played by some object. Having a «RoleOf» property defines the owning class as a role. The role may have multiple occurrences for each base type.
aspectTool.name: Role Of (Property)

aspectTool.description: RolePlayedBy defines the subtype as a role of the supertype. Such a role may have at most one instance per base type.
aspectTool.name: Role Played By (Generalization)

aspectTool.description: A union is a simple type whose values are the union of the values of one or more other simple types, which are the member types of the union.
aspectTool.name: Union (DataType)

aspectTool.description: A union is a simple type whose values are the union of the values of one or more other simple types, which are the member types of the union.
aspectTool.name: Union Of (Usage)

aspectTool.description: The «ValueRestriction» stereotype applies to a UML data type that is a specialization of a more general data type. It defines restrictions on which values of the general data type are allowed as values of the specialized data type.
aspectTool.name: Value Restriction (DataType)

aspectTool.description: The «ValueRestriction» stereotype applies to a UML data type that is a specialization of a more general data type. It defines restrictions on which values of the general data type are allowed as values of the specialized data type.
aspectTool.name: Value Restriction (Enumeration)

aspectTool.description: The «ValueRestriction» stereotype applies to a UML data type that is a specialization of a more general data type. It defines restrictions on which values of the general data type are allowed as values of the specialized data type.
aspectTool.name: Value Restriction (PrimitiveType)

aspectTool.description: An «XSDAnyProperty» property may have a value of any type. It is implemented in XML schema as an xsd:any.
aspectTool.name: XSD Any Property (Property)

aspectTool.description: A property relates a NIEM object (the subject) to another object or to a value (the object). Property data describes an object as having a characteristic with a specific value or a particular relationship to another object.
aspectTool.name: XSD Property (Property)

aspectTool.description: Restricts how data is formatted in XML.
aspectTool.name: XSD Representation Restriction (DataType)

aspectTool.description: Restricts how data is formatted in XML.
aspectTool.name: XSD Representation Restriction (Enumeration)

aspectTool.description: Restricts how data is formatted in XML.
aspectTool.name: XSD Representation Restriction (PrimitiveType)

aspectTool.description: The «XSDSimpleContent» stereotype represents a relationship between two type definitions: the first is a complex type definition with simple content whose content type is the second. This relationship is implemented in XML Schema through base attribute on the xsd:extension or xsd:restriction element of the first type definition, the actual value of which resolves to the second type definition.
aspectTool.name: XSD Simple Content (Realization)
